newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks up in early morning on blue-chip buys.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks up in early morning on blue-chip buys.

text.p: Tokyo stocks rose in early morning trade on Friday as the yen's easing against the dollar encouraged buying of major export-oriented issues, such as high-technology and automobile firms, brokers said.
After 12 minutes of trade, the 225-share Nikkei average was up 112.11 points or 0.56 percent at 19,989.50. Nikkei June futures rose 180 points to 20,030.
Exporters' shares had been pressured by heavy profit-taking during the yen's recent sharp rally, brokers said.
"There is a growing belief in the market that the dollar hit a low earlier this week," said a senior broker at a second-tier Japanese securities house.
